definition: to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse

sentences.english: Man is the only creature that consumes without producing.
sentences.chinese: 人是一種最可憐的傢伙，什麼都產不了，只會揮霍。

sentences.english: He blued 9000 yuan in a holiday.
sentences.chinese: 他一個假期就揮霍了9000元。

sentences.english: He soon made away with his fortune.
sentences.chinese: 他很快就把財產揮霍一空。

sentences.english: He's frittered away the money his father left him.
sentences.chinese: 他揮霍掉了父親留給他的錢財。

sentences.english: We'll splurge on a trip in France next year.
sentences.chinese: 明年咱們去法國揮霍玩個痛快。

sentences.english: We are such spendthrifts with our lives.
sentences.chinese: 我們是我們人生裏怎樣的一羣揮霍者。

sentences.english: You have only wasted your life.
A large amount of money was squandered by him on gambling.
sentences.chinese: 在過去一段時間，他把大量的金錢揮霍在了賭博上。

sentences.english: Fritter away one's money on gambling.
a lottery, then spend it all in a few days.
sentences.chinese: 但在幾天之內就揮霍一空了。

sentences.english: Those prodigals were put into prison.
sentences.chinese: 那些揮霍者被關進監獄。

sentences.english: There was tut - tutting about American profligacy .
sentences.chinese: 中國對美國的肆意揮霍發出了不滿的嘖嘖聲。

sentences.english: He soon kissed away a large fortune.
sentences.chinese: 他行爲荒淫，很快便揮霍掉了一大筆財富。

sentences.english: He started squandering and squandered with such spirit, that all his worldly wealth was I. O. U.
sentences.chinese: 他開始大肆揮霍，直到所有的財富都成了欠條。

sentences.english: The government officials launched into extravagance.
sentences.chinese: 這些政府官員瘋狂地進行揮霍。

sentences.english: I chuck about my money in a gambling machine every time I go to the casino.
sentences.chinese: 每一次我去賭場，我都在賭博機上揮霍我的錢。
